Owls will also direct new players to the rules and familiarize the players with the perks of the server.``

Requirements:

argo:

``Argonauts are the backbone of the server. The job of an Argo is to enforce the rules of the server in a professional manner. Argos must be proficient in Core Protect commands in order to provide â€œinsurance servicesâ€ for players that experience glitch/lag related accidents.``

sr_argo:
âš” Senior Argonaut, Server and Staff Rules Enforcer
Rank of â€œ**Sr. Argo**â€ âš”

Description:
``A Senior Argonaut is a very important role. Not only you have the responsibilities of an Argonaut, your job also is to â€œModerate the Argonauts and Owlsâ€. A Sr. Argo must keep the respect of their subordinates in order to perform adequately. Ensuring Argos are performing their work flawlessly and following Server and Staff rules. Sr. Argos must ensure that Argos are well versed in Core Protect and the help ticket process by performing unannounced exercises on the mods then providing feedback. A Sr. Argonaut must give warnings to Argonauts and Owls who aren't performing to standard and must recommend demotions of Argonauts and the promotions of Owls to the Owners.``

Requirements:
``Must maintain a clean player history``
``Must be active at least 4 days a week``
``Maintain a professional and respectable attitude towards players and staff members``
``Follow all server and Discord rules``
``Maintain accurate time schedule in â€œStaff Schedulingâ€ document``
``Reports to Angler``

Responsibilities:
``Assist Argonauts in tickets when the discord is flooded with tickets and when Argonauts are unable to resolve the issues.``
``Maintain accountability of all moderators and helpers and ensure projects are being finished in a timely basis``

owlApp:
1) MC Username
2) Age
3) Timezone
4) Available Days/Time
5) What languages are you fluent in?
6) Do you share your Minecraft account with anyone else?

1) How long have you been playing on ArkTerra?
2) Have you ever been banned? If so, please explain.
3) How have you already helped the players.
4) What is the most memorable experience you have had on Ark Terra.
5) Tell us about a time you've made a mistake. How did you deal with it and what did you learn from it?
6) Do you have any previous server staff experience?
7) What strengths do you think you can bring to the server?
8) Are you willing and able to participate in staff voice chats when needed?
9) What made you decide to want to become a staff member for ArkTerra?

1) You find a bug that allows you to duplicate items and staff isn't aware of it. What do you do ?

2) You're playing with your friend and he accidentally kills someone else's cow. How would you handle that?

3) You are in a group chat with your friends building a massive survival build. You notice someone in the game chat asking for help with commands and a second person messaging you privately because someone is being rude and obnoxious in voice chat. During this time a third person has pinged you in Discord to report a hacker. What do you do?

**Ping an admin when you have completely filled out your application.**

1) In-game username

readmefirst:
Welcome to ArkTerra!

Website: https://www.arkterramc.com/ 
Server Announcements: <#638828697796739073>
Server Updates: <#691172262677708840>
Help: <#639201700003184641>

__**Rules:**__
-No uninvited pvp
-No theft
-No griefing
-No unnecessary drama
-No inappropriate player, mob, or item names
-No spamming chat
-No continuous inappropriate language
-Anything that occurs on your account, is your fault
-Respect others and their opinions, harassment will NOT be tolerated
-Staff are there for your protection, donâ€™t waste their time
-NSFW is NOT allowed (PG-13)
-Don't give out other's personal information
-No discussion or performance of exploits/hacks
-Do not use an alternate account to provide advantages
-Do not argue with staff and follow staff instruction
-Do not provide false/misleading information on purpose
-Do not advertise other servers outside of the correct channel
(Advertising in-game towns or shops is allowed and encouraged)
